title: Fire Elementalist

***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

|   |                                                                                                                           |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | Fire Elementalists have learned the Foxfire spell. Their other starting spells are likewise focused on fiery destruction. |

**Fire Elementalists** are mages who have specialized in [Fire Magic](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic"). This sets them up for greater destructive power than most spellcasters, particularly in the realm of [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations"), but leaves them without any sort of support or defensive magic in the early game.

## Contents

- [1 Preferred Species](#Preferred_Species)
- [2 Starting Equipment](#Starting_Equipment)
- [3 Starting Skills and Stats](#Starting_Skills_and_Stats)
- [4 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [4.1 Spell Details](#Spell_Details)
- [5 History](#History)

## Preferred Species

[Hill Orc](/Hill_Orc "Hill Orc"), [Gargoyle](/Gargoyle "Gargoyle"), [Tengu](/Tengu "Tengu"), [Deep Elf](/Deep_Elf "Deep Elf"), [Demigod](/Demigod "Demigod"), [Naga](/Naga "Naga"), and [Djinni](/Djinni "Djinni") are the recommended species if you pick a Fire Elementalist Background.

## Starting Equipment

- +0 [robe](/Robe "Robe")
- [Potion of magic](/Potion_of_magic "Potion of magic")

**Available Spells:**

- [Foxfire](/Foxfire "Foxfire")
- [Scorch](/Scorch "Scorch")
- [Volatile Blastmotes](/Volatile_Blastmotes "Volatile Blastmotes")
- [Inner Flame](/Inner_Flame "Inner Flame")
- [Flame Wave](/Flame_Wave "Flame Wave")

Fire elementalists start with the [Foxfire](/Foxfire "Foxfire") spell memorised.

## Starting Skills and Stats

These are adjusted by your species' [aptitudes](/Aptitude "Aptitude").

- [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging"): 2
- [Stealth](/Stealth "Stealth"): 2
- [Spellcasting](/Spellcasting "Spellcasting"): 2
- [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations"): 1
- [Fire Magic](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic"): 3

Choosing Fire Elementalist adds 7 to your starting [Intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence") and 5 to your starting [Dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity").

## Strategy

Fire Elementalists are particularly destructive magicians; only [Conjurers](/Conjurer "Conjurer") have a comparable set of damaging spells. All 3 of FE's direct damage spells are on the stronger side, and can never be [evaded](/Ev "Ev") - which contributes more to damage than you'd think.

As most Fire spells are also [Conjurations](/Conjuration "Conjuration"), it may be worthwhile to focus on training that skill (over Fire Magic) in order to have more spell options later on.

### Spell Details

Fire Elementalists struggle slightly at XL 1, due to the finicky nature of [Foxfire](/Foxfire "Foxfire"). While Foxfire has perfect accuracy and strong damage, it requires open tiles to create and traverse through. Beware of hallways! In a pinch, you can stand in the corner of a hallway, opening up a diagonal to allow foxfires behind you to pass. [Scorch](/Scorch "Scorch") is easier to use, but has its own quirks: it is limited to 3 range and targets randomly. However, Scorch also makes targets vulnerable to fire, giving it plenty of use throughout the Dungeon.

The level 3 spells can also be difficult to use. [Volatile Blastmotes](/Volatile_Blastmotes "Volatile Blastmotes") and [Inner Flame](/Inner_Flame "Inner Flame") both do good damage, but can harm the user if they are not careful. See their respective pages for more details.

Finally, [Flame Wave](/Flame_Wave "Flame Wave") deals great damage to every foe in the surrounding area, especially for a level 4 spell. Flame Wave can be channeled; able to be cast twice more with a greater range for only 1 MP. However, don't get too greedy; Flame Wave has a small radius, and nearby monsters might be able to tear you apart.

## History

- In [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), [Conjure Flame](/Conjure_Flame "Conjure Flame") was replaced with [Volatile Blastmotes](/Volatile_Blastmotes "Volatile Blastmotes").
- In [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), most backgrounds were buffed; all Mage backgrounds gained a [potion of magic](/Potion_of_magic "Potion of magic").
- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), Fire Elmentalists started with [Sticky Flame](/Sticky_Flame "Sticky Flame") and [Fireball](/Fireball "Fireball") instead of [Scorch](/Scorch "Scorch") and [Flame Wave](/Flame_Wave "Flame Wave").
- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), Fire Elementalists started with the [Book of Flames](/Book_of_Flames "Book of Flames"); FE's spells were unaffected.
- Prior to [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"), Fire Elementalists started with [Flame Tongue](/Flame_Tongue "Flame Tongue") instead of [Foxfire](/Foxfire "Foxfire") and had [Throw Flame](/Throw_Flame "Throw Flame").
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), Fire Elementalists only started with 1 level of Spellcasting.

Fire Elementalists have learned the Foxfire spell. Their other starting spells are likewise focused on fiery destruction.

Fire Elementalists are mages who have specialized in Fire Magic. This sets them up for greater destructive power than most spellcasters, particularly in the realm of Conjurations, but leaves them without any sort of support or defensive magic in the early game.

Contents

  • 2 Starting Equipment
  • 3 Starting Skills and Stats
  • 4 Strategy
    • 4.1 Spell Details
  • 5 History

Preferred Species

Hill Orc, Gargoyle, Tengu, Deep Elf, Demigod, Naga, and Djinni are the recommended species if you pick a Fire Elementalist Background.

Starting Equipment

  • +0 robe
  • Potion of magic

Available Spells:

  • Foxfire
  • Scorch
  • Volatile Blastmotes
  • Inner Flame
  • Flame Wave

Fire elementalists start with the Foxfire spell memorised.

  • Dodging: 2
  • Stealth: 2
  • Spellcasting: 2
  • Conjurations: 1

History

  • In 0.30, Conjure Flame was replaced with Volatile Blastmotes.
  • In 0.29, most backgrounds were buffed; all Mage backgrounds gained a potion of magic.
  • Prior to 0.28, Fire Elmentalists started with Sticky Flame and Fireball instead of Scorch and Flame Wave.
